key_points: Stacey Plaskett is the first delegate in American history to be part of a team of impeachment managers.
Democratic congressman Jamie Raskin, from Maryland, introduced Plaskett with pride during the Senate trial of former President Donald Trump.
Plaskett is currently representing the US Virgin Islands' at-large congressional district and is in her fourth term.
As a delegate of a US territory, Plaskett cannot cast votes on the House floor, including the impeachment vote against Trump.
She participates in the Senate trial as a prosecutor, aiming to prove Trump incited an insurrection.
Plaskett is one of nine House Democrats serving as impeachment managers for the trial.
Before Congress, she worked as an assistant district attorney and senior counsel at the US Department of Justice.
Plaskett emphasized her personal and professional journey, highlighting her background and commitment to truth and preparation.
There are currently five delegates representing various non-state territories in the House of Representatives.
Raskin, who was Plaskett's law professor, commended her academic excellence and current performance.
